alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 08 at 10:41AM EST until January 10 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall and snow melt is possible. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Maine, including the following counties, in south central Maine, Kennebec and Lincoln. In southwest Maine, Androscoggin. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with snow and other debris. Small stream flooding will also be possible.
info.instruction: You should monitor the latest forecast and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Now is the time to prepare by clearing snow from drains. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
